fields.headline: Hop to it
fields.bodyText: London Throughout April, you can take part in London's biggest Easter egg hunt on the London Eye. Spot a giant golden egg hidden somewhere in London's skyline to win a ranch holiday for four to Colorado, including the opportunity to hunt for real gold. Fast track tickets cost £22.50 if you book online and include priority boarding, a souvenir guidebook and children's packs with binoculars. Children under five go free. BA London Eye; 0870 5000 600. Devon Barton Hall in South Devon is offering three-night family Easter breaks complete with egg-hurling competitions, an Easter egg hunt and giant papier-maché egg-making. To burn off the excess calories, abseiling, quad biking and swimming will also be on offer. The price of £156 per person includes three nights' full-board accommodation for breaks departing April 7, 14 or 21. Reduced rate of £114 for children under 18, £68 for those aged two to five. PGL Travel; 08700 507 507. Oxfordshire For those with an appetite for more than chocolate who are looking to pick up a new skill during the holidays, Le Manoir aux Quat' Saisons is running one-day junior cookery courses created by Raymond Blanc. La Petite Ecole will offer the opportunity to create a lunch feast using organic and seasonal produce, with tastings and a tea party in the hotel grounds. Courses run on April 18, 19 and 20 for children aged from seven to 16. A family of three can stay overnight for £900 including French breakfast, a three-course dinner, full tuition, chef whites and a cookbook. Le Manoir; 01844 278 881. St Tropez Further afield, you could book a bargain break in the French riviera by renting a mobile home at the L'Etoile d'Argens Parc in St Aygulf. Just north of St Tropez, the park is surrounded by forests and vineyards and has a pool complex, volleyball, tennis courts, bar and restaurant. Departing April 15, a family of five can stay for a week for £333, excluding travel. Eurocamp; 0870 366 7552. Thailand For something completely different, the world's biggest water fight will take place in Bangkok between April 13 and 15 in celebration of the Thai new year (Songkran). Throughout April, Tell Tale Travel is organising homestay holidays where you can stay as a guest of local people in a private guesthouse in the grounds of a rubber plantation. The price is £500pp and includes 12 nights' accommodation, most meals, domestic flights and transfers. Excludes international flights. Tell Tale Travel; 0800 011 2571.
